The light beam striking the lower gem is cast as a long ray of light on the floor and walls which illuminates one of several ornate inlaid mosaics which appear to depict the various stages of the day.

Abasi begins to pace around the central obelisk, a mixture of surprise and reverence playing on his features. Having only ever read of the Dial in damaged, incomplete texts, the man begins to examine it with a look of wonder and surprise.

Leading from the central platform are four more landings, each marked with another mosaic:

  • A crocodile headed figure with an elaborate headdress.
  • A red vulture flying under the sun.
  • A jackal headed figure on a shield.
  • A scorpion walking across a crescent moon.

For more on the Dial of Aten's mechanics and related macros refer to:

@UUID[JournalEntry.lgBwEEIkt8ROu4H7.JournalEntryPage.pDTLBaxSb56JS1mk]{Adventure Mechanics}

Investigating the Dial of Aten

Abasi will spend several long minutes examining the Dial of Aten, its markings, and how it works. Much to his shock he will conclude that they have even less time than expected. He will explain that the dial indicates they have only 24 hours remaining until the magical seal breaks and the Demon Queen is free. To be successful, they must hurry.

  • The central pillar that holds the glowing capstone is covered in ancient hieroglyphs, several of which are slowly changing. A successful [[/skill history 15]] or [[/skill investigation 15]] reveals that it’s a repeating sequence of symbols, specifically ancient numbers in a countdown. Given the rate it’s decreasing, there’s only about 24 hours left until it completes.
  • The light beam coming from the ceiling appears to be a golden light, regardless of the time of day it is.
  • The four icons representing the solar cycle on the floor have small circular slots in their center which look like they could accept a quarterstaff or similar dowel.
  • Slotting a quarterstaff into any of the receptacles allows the staff to stand upright, leading you to believe that something is meant to slot into these holes.

Sound Effect: Demon Chains Rattling

This sound effect represents the Demon Queen struggling against the magical chains within the vault.

Play this sound to increase tension, unnerve players, or incite action if they linger in the Dial Room. @UUID[Playlist.b7X2872YARmMKskF.PlaylistSound.WwkqNUUTy6eS2jT3]{Demon Chains Rattling}

What now?

If prompted, Abasi admits that he doesn’t know what to do now. In truth, he only knows that he must rebind the Demon Queen, and expected the Dial to be the mechanism by which to do so. Now that it appears to be a clock, he does not know what the next step is. This will not deter him however, and he recommends they explore, in the hope that the answers reveal themselves as they do.

If the party has not met Last yet: Abasi believes that perhaps checking the chambers of repose would be wise, there may be people there, or information.

If the party has met Last already: Abasi believes that waking the sleeper may provide more information on how things are supposed to work.

If Kesi is present or asked: The priestess will indicate that the Dial of Aten needs the four scepters of the sky, and that should open the way to the Demon Queen. These scepters should be in the sarcophagi of the four champions.

However, given that the generals have gotten loose, they will likely not be taken without a fight, except for @UUID[Actor.gbnQOiVvkJ7PM66C]{Nekhbel-amun}, who is a creature of greed and ambition. The dread general might be open to diplomacy, though he’s utterly evil, and still bound to Nehebkelat, so he should not be trusted.

This begins the @UUID[JournalEntry.cmqoF8Cq3mEIsGPA.JournalEntryPage.24O87rMR82RU9Zmw]{Main Quest: Retrieving the Scepters}

South-West Hall.name: South-West Hall
South-West Hall.text:
Damp Halls and Echoes

As you pass into the hallway beyond the crocodile headed mosaic you begin to notice the dull hiss and rumble of water flowing ahead. As you continue forward you notice the air becoming more damp, and the growing smell of plant life. Ancient urns rest against the walls, and old, tattered banners hang off the walls, faded beyond recognition. As you near the door at the end of the hallway the roar of flowing water grows to its loudest point.

Continue on toward...

@UUID[.MwQMOshR3SD8Mkan]{1f. The Sepulcher of Dawn}

The Sepulcher of Dawn.name: The Sepulcher of Dawn
The Sepulcher of Dawn.text:
Water floods this chamber from several grated openings around the room, the sounds of rushing water echo off of the stone walls. As the water flows into the lower areas it forms a turbulent pool that is cold and murky. The flow of the water is constant, but the chamber does not completely fill, perhaps cycling out through physical or magical means.

Braziers attached high up on the walls burn with powerful green flame, bathing the area in bright, verdant light as water-borne lotus flowers bob and float on the surface, perpetually blooming and lovely even without natural light.

At the center of this chamber a broad platform holds a sealed tomb of white stone adorned with turquoise, gold, and silver. Canopic jars are carefully nested against it, accompanied by pots of vibrant flowers that defy their age and lack of sunlight here.

Toward the rear of the chamber a huge throne is nestled between two outlets noisily spilling water. A massive, hulking form sits atop the throne, one hand toying with the hilt of a great sword. This figure is covered in rough, green hide, has long claws at the ends of his fingertips, and the head of a crocodile.

Rising from his throne, Ansubek the Shadow Beneath claims the greatsword in one hand and rolls his shoulders, preparing for battle. He speaks in a strange dialect of Primordial Aquan, and seems not to care whether the party can understand him or not.

"Ah, mortals! I have not tasted living flesh in far too long. You foolish interlopers will make a fine meal!"

Vault Ambience: Sepulcher of Dawn

When the players first enter this room, begin playing this ambient track! @UUID[Playlist.td6mebjCgVupaImA.PlaylistSound.dWaW67hvVOC1IW8j]{Sepulcher of Dawn}

Encounter: Ansubek, the Shadow Beneath

As soon as @UUID[Actor.DuC2iYlEwSOtqY0Z]{Ansubek} sees one of Abasi's band of would-be heroes he becomes hostile! It is possible to sneak past the dread general, perhaps to steal things from the Sepulcher, but he has a good view of both entrances from his perch on his throne, making it a difficult proposition to begin with. The only advantage that a sneaking character has is in the form of the rushing water which masks sound quite well and imposes disadvantage on any attempts to hear things.

Who Is Ansubek?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with Kesi, the party can learn:

Ansubek is an elemental monstrosity who escaped from the Elemental Plane of Water to the Prime Material and had been terrorizing the lands unchecked for centuries before joining the Demon Queen. He is violent and unhinged, caring only for his next battle or meal. During the empire of blood's height he commanded an army of elementals and their ilk, protecting the Queen's rivers, ports, and ships while raiding those of her enemies.

Ansubek’s Tactics

Ansubek revels in combat, slaughter, and violence. He wants nothing more than to engage in battle and then eat the losers. When beginning combat he will focus on whoever appears to be the biggest and toughest combatant in the arriving party. If this initial decision appears wrong, and someone else starts dealing large amounts of damage, he will reprioritize to the new, most "worthy" opponent. A clever and well coordinated party can use this tendency against him to manage his aggression and who he targets.

Ansubek is unbelievably strong, and relies on his multi-attack to get the bulk of his work done. He can use his hide bonus action and legendary movement to set up his attacks and give himself some space to reassess the battlefield, but his cunning is limited and he prefers direct action as often as possible. If a creature is proving troublesome or elusive for him, he can use his bite to hold them in place and death roll to rip them apart.

Ansubek should...

  • Use his multi-attack to rip apart enemies that decide to square up against him in melee. While the Waters Rise is active, he can be especially brazen since most enemies can't easily retaliate or attack him.
  • Target vulnerable enemies with his lurking danger, pulling them into water and grappling them.
  • Avoid opportunity attacks and relocate through the use of his Shadow Beneath ability.

Sound Effect: Ansubek Growl

This sound effect is meant for when Ansubek's uses his Dreadful Vibrations legendary action, but it can be used for any general vocalizations and roaring the monstrous general might make! @UUID[Playlist.b7X2872YARmMKskF.PlaylistSound.iJa5eIBjrgzvRDap]{Ansubek Growl}

Combat Barks

Ansubek does not have much to say during battle, and mostly mocks or provokes his foes, attempting to incite them to action, or strike fear in them to give himself the upper hand. He speaks Primordial, specifically an ancient Aquan dialect that sounds strange to any that understand the language.

  • "It has been far too long since blood swirled within these waters."
  • "You will learn that nothing is stronger than the rushing waters!"
  • "I will take great pleasure in ripping you apart!"

Ansubek's Macros

Underwater Token macro tints Ansubek’s token and makes it slightly smaller to give him the appearance of being under the water’s surface. To use, select Ansubek and click the macro. If Ansubek is already submerged, this will remove the effect. This macro can be used on any selected token, if desired. @UUID[Macro.jXJrpZ2rwcNJEygN]{Toggle Underwater Token}

The Waters Rise macro toggles a roof tile that creates a flooded effect as the arena fills with water. This should be used to visually represent when the general’s lair action is active, and used again when the water recede. This automatically closes the sepulcher door if it's still open, and locks it shut. @UUID[Macro.LAnfsxQgPEydR6HU]{Toggle Waters Rise Effect}

Ansubek Bridge Toggle makes a bridge appear in the gap between the sepulcher's entrance and the platform where the hero's sarcophagus is located. This bridge should appear after Ansubek is defeated. @UUID[Macro.0bvBrPoZTEMCvP8q]{Toggle Ansubek Bridge}

Sarcophagus of Dawn

Sarcophagus of Anneke

Ornate and beautiful, the sarcophagus is made of white stone that appears to have been attacked and damaged in several places by a heavy weapon, but has not broken entirely. Decorated with turquoise, gold, and silver, the figure on the cover is depicted as a young woman at rest. Several fine urns and pots with ever-blooming flowers are arranged around the sarcophagus' base. The stone of the sarcophagus bears several markings of magical and religious significance.

Who was Anneke?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with Kesi, the party can learn:

Anneke, the First Light of Day, was once the order's greatest leader. She was a Bard of great eloquence, a source of inspiration, hope, and guidance for the order even in its darkest times. It was said that she had every story and every name of the order memorized, and knew where every safehouse and vault was hidden in the land. Those of the order knew her for her warm-heart, sharp-tongue, and love of stories.

Investigating the Sarcophagus

There are inscriptions etched around the base of the sarcophagus which are partially obscured by plants and urns, but are still highly legible.

  • [[/skill arcana 20]] This sarcophagus is marked with ancient draconic magic symbols of power that are simultaneously preserving the body within for a nearly unlimited time period, and directing the occupant's life force elsewhere in the vault.
  • [[/skill history 20]] The elaborate pictograms depict a woman playing all manner of ancient musical instruments, often for large audiences, or unknown royal figures. She is always depicted with a sky blue cloak. Much of the imagery lines up with an ancient musician, poet, and artist known as Anneke. See: Who was Anneke? above for guidance on what this legend might entail.
  • [[/skill religion 20]] The religious pictograms show a person of great importance to this group, someone who was responsible for leadership, guidance, and even matchmaking. See: Who was Anneke? above for guidance on what role this champion played in the Eyes of Aten.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): The old form of celestial script that appears on the base identifies the occupant as the Champion Anneke, the First Light of Day. It proclaims that she was Charismatic and Intelligent, and that through these abilities she outwitted and tricked Ansubek, leading to his capture and imprisonment here.

Items Within

@Item[1f84qjjZINpneUGD]{The Mantle of Names}

@Item[HDDzcOJUyoIwQP6v]{Scepter of Dawn}

North-West Hall.name: North-West Hall
North-West Hall.text:
Halls of Salt and Dust

As you travel down the hall beyond the avian mosaic floor the air becomes dusty, and bitter, with a stench of rot and salt finds its way into your throat. The light from the Dial of Aten only reaches so far past the entryway, being replaced by dim orange light barely up to the task of illuminating the hallway that continues onward.  

Ancient urns sit against the walls in small groups and clusters. Everything in this hallway is slightly dusty. From somewhere ahead, a dull, repetive banging sound echoes off of the bare stone walls.

Continue on toward...

@UUID[.samRQxdYtO0GIJwJ]{1h. Embalming Chamber}

@UUID[.KAHZuhRY0YJuoVoc]{1i. West Sub-Vault}

or

@UUID[.flzpZlZt8ZTeVBNK]{1j. The Sepulcher of Day}

Embalming Chamber.name: Embalming Chamber
Embalming Chamber.text:
At the Old Door

You hear quiet moaning and the intermittent sound of objects shifting. As you stand at the door you can smell the pungeant aroma of salt intermixed with the putrid scent of rotting flesh.

Investigating the Door

Beyond the door is the sound of banging and angry, frustrated growling. The stench of salt and death is concerning.

  • [[/skill perception 15]] By the sound of things there is at least one being inside making a racket and trying to get out! Luckily the door appears to have been jammed from the outside with a wedge of old pottery, and whatever's inside is not strong enough to break the door down.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): Old Celestial script indicates that this is a chamber wherein embalming of the favored dead is to take place.

Encounter: Irate Mummies

Two angry @Actor[zfmCjmlxkSRiBZyq]{Mummies} attack immediately, going for the first creature their rage-filled eyes can find!

After Battle

Once the mummies are dispatched the party can quickly search the room. They find that the place is in absolute disarray, most of the bottles and jars that used to line the walls have been destroyed. Buried under pottery, tools, and spilled salt they find an old leather bound manual of magical and religious rituals.

This item is one of the core components to @UUID[JournalEntry.cmqoF8Cq3mEIsGPA.JournalEntryPage.hUb53NOjbZ2OILqh]{Side Quest 1: Waking the Sleeper}.

The Embalming Chamber

This chamber is small, cramped, and smells strongly of salt. The walls are lined with shelves packed with jars, some empty, some full of natron, or dessicated organs. A table sits at the center of the room covered in tools and holy items necessary to prepare and inter the dead.

A pair of slabs with stained death shrouds rest at the back of the room. They have lips around their edges, to keep the natron salts in place while a body is being dried and prepared. Sadly, the bodies once on this slab are no longer present, and are currently smashing the room.

West Sub-Vault.name: West Sub-Vault
West Sub-Vault.text:
Large Treasure Vault

The heavy stone door is a chore to push aside, and as soon as the door is open you can smell the scent of metal and old rotting wood. Even the barest amount of light shone within this room is reflected ten-fold by the mounds of glittering gold and gems within!  

This large room is filled with literal piles of treasure: gold coins, gold bars, glittering jewelry, gems of all shapes and sizes, and all manner of other valuables. Crates and chests sit nestled in piles of coin, practically overflowing with treasures of all kinds. There are more riches in this room than a hundred bodies could carry!

Examining the Treasure Room's contents

The vault contains enough gold for everyone in the party to retire and never work another day in their life.

  • All told there's easily 500,000 gp worth of coin in this vault.

    • The gold and electrum coins piled in this vault originate from kingdoms long forgotten, or changed by the marches of time, many of them bearing the marks of unfamiliar nations, and faces of unknown rulers. 
    • Jars of silver coins bear marks from kingdoms that have long been rumored to exist beyond the vast burning deserts but have never been discovered. 
  • Opening the crates reveals ancient jars of grain, and beer carefully nesteled in now rotten hay. The sealed containers are in shockingly good shape, and might even still be consumable!
  • Scattered around the piles are about 12 gold ingots stamped with makers' marks that are utterly unfamiliar.
  • One large crate holds 500 lbs of coiled gold chain that is finely crafted and immensely heavy!
  • An ornate wooden box contains a matched set of pure gold scimitars that would be worthless in battle but are exquisitely decorated and likely to be immensely valuable.
  • Scattered around the piles of gold are another 100,000 gp worth of assorted valuables including golden circlets and headpieces, goblets, necklaces, pendants, idols, statuettes.

The Sepulcher of Day.name: The Sepulcher of Day
The Sepulcher of Day.text:
This chamber is made up of narrow columns of differing heights which reach up out of a pit of darkness that seems to go down about forty feet, ending in a floor piled with bones, feathers, and muck. The room stinks horribly of dust and rot, and the pit seethes with shadows that do not fully obey the light.

Nests of bone, mud, and feathers sit on the tops of the pillars, some of them holding canopic jars with avian designs. At the far end of the chamber is a massive nest built around a sarcophagus that appears to have been partially opened.

There, hunched over a pile of jars, cooing to them lovingly is the terrible sight of @UUID[Actor.gbnQOiVvkJ7PM66C]{Nekhbel-Amun, the Watchful Eye}. He is humanoid, barely, a cross of man and vulture with broad wings from long, thin limbs tipped with sharp talons. In one clawed hand he holds a staff tipped with a radiant gold orb. Upon spotting the group he wraps his wings around himself, hiding it from sight.

The Dread General cocks his head, taking in the group. His first words are in Auran, and he proclaims loudly, "Oh, visitors! I have foreseen your arrival. What baubles and treasures have you brought to me?"

Vault Ambience: Sepulcher of Day

When the players first enter this room, begin playing this ambient track! @UUID[Playlist.td6mebjCgVupaImA.PlaylistSound.vy5OTyQCem24k8Dt]{Sepulcher of Day}

Encounter: Nekhbel-Amun, the Watchful Eye?

Nekhbel-Amun does not begin his encounter hostile, but instead is curious about the party and what he can get from them. He will attempt to make a deal to provide them the staff of day and treasures in exchange for the various avian themed urns lying around the vault.

Nekhbel-Amun initially speaks in Auran, but once he realizes the heroes cannot understand him will cast the Tongues spell on himself so that he can freely converse with them.

Who is Nekbhel-Amun

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with @UUID[Actor.dXpHPQLRNOqj8SAm]{Kesi}, the party can learn:

Nekhbel-Amun was once a mortal man of legendary avarice. For his blind selfishness and insatiable greed the gods cursed him, twisting his form into that of a hybrid between vulture and man. Outcast, he would languish forever at the edges of mortal society, only allowed access to the scraps they left behind. In his despair he turned to desperately gathering up shreds of magic, and making deals with otherwordly beings in the hopes of restoring himself. He is the least loyal of Nehebkelat's generals, having only agreed to serve her because the immortality she could grant him assured him the time to find an end to his curse.

Nekhbel-Amun’s Macros

Pit Token Effect makes the selected token smaller and partially transparent, giving it the appearance of being down in the pit in Nekhbel-Amun's arena. If the token is already modified by this macro, using it again will remove the effect. @UUID[Macro.QZA0yUn0b7bS2qQ6]{Toggle Pit Token}

Nekhbel-Amun’s Tactics

Nekhbel-Amun prefers to fight from afar, if possible, using his Eldritch Blast to push and pull opponents into the pit where the horrible acidic muck can do its work. He uses his swarms of vultures to distract and inconvenience ranged fighters, while attempting to disable or kill any enemies that present an immediate threat to him.

If things get very dire he may create  a wall of force or wind wall (see his spellbook) to hold the enemy at bay while he devises a better set of tactics to defeat his enemies.

Sound Effect: Vulture Swarm

A cackling, screeching swarm of vultures sound effect is available when Wake of Shadows is used. @UUID[Playlist.b7X2872YARmMKskF.PlaylistSound.B0IvZxfpMBroTNYX]{Vulture Swarm}

Environmental Hazard

Pit of the Blind

Nekbhel-Amun's arena is filled with a 40ft deep pit filled with bird droppings, rotting remains of vultures, and a viscous, acidic black tar. Creatures falling into this pit take falling damage as normal and additional acid damage on the Pit of the Blind lair action during combat. @UUID[Macro.QZA0yUn0b7bS2qQ6]{Toggle Pit Token}

Escaping the Pit

The pit can be escaped a number of ways:

  • Climb the stone with Athletics. The slimy, acidic stone is a difficult vertical surface to scale. A successful [[/skill ath dc=18]] is necessary to to climb it. Failure causes the creature to lose their grip and slide down 10 feet. On a critical failure they fall back into the pit entirely.
  • Use flight or climbing abilities. A creature with a climb speed or fly speed can exit the pit using their movement.
  • Trudge toward the base of the stairs. Trudging to the southern end of the arena also allows a creature to climb up onto the landing at the bottom of the stairs without a check.

Combat Barks

In combat he will attempt to demoralize and intimidate his foes, largely speaking of his magical prowess. As the fight shifts out of his control however he will begin to realize the fate in store for him and starts to panic.

  • "You cannot see what fate awaits you, but I can. I have seen myself feasting upon your flesh, puny mortals!"
  • "I wonder what secrets I will find in your marrow!"
  • "Your magic pales in comparison to that which my Queen has given me!"
  • "Your magic will be mine!"
  • "You cannot have the scepter, I found it first!"
  • "I'll never go back into the pit, I can see nothing there!"

Sarcophagus of Day

Sarcophagus of Ta-Khara

Settled in the center of a huge, dirty nest made of muck, feathers and bones is a pale stone sarcophagus that appears to have suffered damage, possibly from being pried open by reckless hands. The figure on the cover of this sarcophagus is detailed with paints of regal blue, pure whites, and embellished with gold.

This figure’s face is feminine and has closed eyes. The air around the sarcophagus resonates with a power that brings a feeling of invigoration; as though you are ready for anything. The stone around this tomb bears an equal measure of arcane and religious inscription.

Who was Ta-Khara?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with Kesi, the party can learn:

Ta-khara, the Daughter of the Sun was once the order's most powerful warrior. She was a Paladin dedicated to the act of destroying evil and redeeming good people who had fallen into darkness. She was known to be good hearted, and kind to all she met, but fiercer than a hundred lions in battle, able to wrap her weapons in the light of the sun and use it to burn evil away.

Investigating the Sarcophagus

Inscriptions around the base of the sarcophagus are partially obscured by bones and muck which must be scraped way to study properly.

  • [[/skill arc dc=20]] This sarcophagus is marked with ancient draconic magic symbols of power that are simultaneously preserving the body within for a nearly unlimited time period, and directing the occupant's life force elsewhere in the vault.
  • [[/skill his dc=20]] The elaborate pictograms depict a woman with a sword made of fire and light. She is depicted slaying all manner of strange monsters, but also seen curing many of them of evil, or casting demons out of them. Much of the imagery lines up with a legendary hero known as the Daughter of the Sun.  See: Who was Ta-Khara? above for guidance on what her legend might entail.
  • [[/skill rel dc=20]] The religious pictograms show a woman leading an army, healing the injured, and delivering blessings to robed figures. See: Who was Ta-Khara? above for guidance on what role this champion played in the Eyes of Aten.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): The old form of celestial script that appears on the base identifies the occupant as the Champion Ta-Khara, Daughter of the Sun. It proclaims that she was Strong and Charismatic, and that through these abilities she was able to befuddle and subdue the wily Nekhbel-Amun, leading to his capture and imprisonment here.

Items Within

@Item[Omm5yBkRuRDJWHbu]{Disc of Daylight}

@Item[vQYYUsoOuuIcyZm6]{The Horizon Blade}

@Item[nbyAGGdbdYaEPQSW]{Scepter of Day}

North-East Hall.name: North-East Hall
North-East Hall.text:
Halls of Smoke and Fire

As you travel down the hall beyond the jackal-headed mosaic floor the air becomes dry and begins to taste bitter. A thin haze of smoke fills the entryway, growing stronger and thicker with each step down this hall. You soon spot great iron braziers crackling and spewing purple smoke, clearly the source of the acrid tinge in the air that stings your eyes.

Continue on toward...

@UUID[.iFx5uK9r7A8UIquB]{1l. East Sub-Vault}

or

@UUID[.x6EXTaq8AqWD62rF]{1m. Ushabti Trap}

East Sub-Vault.name: East Sub-Vault
East Sub-Vault.text:
North-East Treasure Vault

This small room is piled with gold and gems which sparkle in the light from the open door. Cobwebs span across the ceiling and the scent of dust mixed with old metal and acrid smoke from outside the vault compete for a place at the forefront of your senses. 

Every now and then there's a faint thump of wood and jostling of coins somewhere at the back of the room.

Examining the Treasure Room's contents

Though it would take some time to examine the contents, it's obvious that there's enough gold for the party to retire and likely never work another day in their life. Providing they could find a way to transport it, and of course assuming they survive this whole ordeal!

Examining items in the treasure vault takes about 5 minutes of work to learn anything below, but does not require any skill checks to accomplish.

  • A massive chest constructed of iron and rotting wood is packed with ancient bars of electrum, and silver that are stamped with makers marks that will never be matched to a creators. All told there are over a twenty ingots of silver and platinum each.
  • Piles of coin, jewelry, art pieces and gems easily amount to about 200,000 gp worth of valuables! 
  • A few random gold ingots sit nestled in the gold piles, about six all told, the maker marks are unfamiliar.
  • There is an ornate chest half buried in gold with a rather new looking dagger jammed into its latch, preventing it from opening. The chest jostles every now and then. Something is alive inside it!

The Celestial Friend

Ornate Box

In the corner of the room, half-buried in gold, a wooden box jostles and thumps dully as though something within is trying to escape! The box itself is in surprisingly good shape, and bares intricate painted art of a great snake with wings. It flies under a symbol of the sun, and the box itself is adorned with various religious symbols. A fine bronze latch keeps the box locked, and a bit of thin bronze chain attaches a key to it.

If the box is opened a huge blue cobra with yellow streaks in its scales and broad hawk wings bolts out and flies around the room! The sleek serpent wends through the air, happy to be free.

@UUID[Actor.CckHunjSIN9oWseb]{Uraeus} uses the attributes of the Couatl and has all of the same abilities. She happily assists the group as long as their intentions are good. If reduced to 0 hp she vanishes in a flash of light, returning to her home plane and is not seen again.

Speaking to Uraeus

In a reedy, sibilant voice the flying snake declares itself to be Uraeus, a servant to the protector goddess Wadjet. She was sent to be a faithful ally in events yet to unfold. Placed within a box and set to sleep until her presence was needed, she only woke up recently and has been trying to get free with no luck!

She is most thankful to be free, and happy to be of service however possible!

Ushabti Trap.name: Ushabti Trap
Ushabti Trap.text:
Halls of Smoke and Fire

At the end of the hazy corridors a broad room sits bare save for the ubiquitous jackal headed statues found all over the vault, with old urns scattered around the space.

There is also a trio of stone Ushabti guardians in this area. They look much like Last does though their bodies are marked with glowing purple symbols which slowly exude a purple smoke not unlike the braziers hanging high up on the walls. This light also pours from their eyes and mouth.

As you first walk into this space their eyes open up and flash with light as a voice rings out and the braziers flash and sputter with light. The words rattle in your minds more than your ears: "Tell me what you see, my servants."

The corrupted ushabti slowly scan their surroundings with burning eyes then return to stillness.

Vault Ambience: Sepulcher of Dusk

When the players first enter this area, begin playing this ambient track!

Also applies to @UUID[.6TODq5DKCZxTD8tJ]{1n. The Sepulcher of Dusk}. @UUID[Playlist.td6mebjCgVupaImA.PlaylistSound.7yUYmfITtJ24xIjz]{Sepulcher of Dusk}

Encounter: Corrupted Ushabti

The @UUID[Actor.Nk0R5yr4qhhL60zS]{Corrupted Ushabti} in this area are dormant and waiting for threats. They will remain dormant until a disturbance awakens them or something moves through their limited vision cone. While dormant they are limited to only seeing what is about 10 feet ahead of themselves, though their vision can easily pierce illusions and invisibility via &Reference[truesight].

These Corrupted Ushabti however, have sharp hearing and will respond to accidental or intentional sounds, moving to examine the sound. This can be used to reposition the ushabti for an area attack, or to sneak past them.

Anubhet's Vision

Periodically (every minute, or at the end of each round) @UUID[Actor.zDaJ1TbODa2k7YbX]{Anubhet} will force open the eyes of the Corrupted Ushabti, and use their eyes to see what is happening in the room. This expands the Ushabti's vision cone to 30 feet.

Each time this happens Anubhet's voice will call out, saying one of the following:

  • "Ushabti, what transpires beyond my sight?"
  • "Ushabti, reveal to me what lies before you."
  • "Give to me your sight, my servants."
  • "Tell me what you see, my servants."

If Anubhet can see a player character, it will awaken the Corrupted and begin making its way to the battle.

It is entirely possible sneak around the corrupted guardians without being seen, allowing the party to scout the area and set up an ambush. If Anubhet looks through their eyes and realizes one of its servants has gone missing it will awaken the remaining Ushabti to investigate, and may come intervene directly.

Ushabti Macros

Toggle Ushabti Vision turns on the light cones that are part of the corrupted ushabti tokens, projecting the vision cones that represent what Anubhet can see. This allows the GM and players to see the vision cones of the ushabti for the purposes of stealth and detection. @UUID[Macro.Xe9oxpXQHz8U1ovI]{Toggle Ushabti Vision}

Encounter: Anubhet, the Stygian Monolith

It's expected that the party will alert the corrupted Ushabti either through ambush or by stumbling into their view while they are alert. If this happens, Anubhet will begin making its way to the battle, and the text below can be used to narrate the impending encounter.

Otherwise, if the corrupted are bypassed, Anubhet is sitting in the throne room, and will become alerted as soon as a creature enters. It is staring right at the doorway.

Refer to @UUID[.6TODq5DKCZxTD8tJ]{1n. The Sepulcher of Dusk} for more information on Anubhet.

If Anubhet is alerted and on its way to the battle

Heavy footfalls rattle the stone beneath you, and echo from the unexplored halls further ahead. Something massive is making its way to you!

The Anubhet Moving macro plays the sound of stomping feet, making it emanate from two locations in the Sepulcher and just outside it. This can be toggled on and off and is used to indicate that Anubhet is moving toward the fight. @UUID[Macro.ANXU2OkWOlsuoDLv]{Toggle Anubhet Moving Sound}

If Anubhet enters view of the party outside of its throne room

A massive obsidian giant with the head of a jackal and a golden headpiece lumbers into view. Its eyes burn with a terrible light and when it passes the braziers hung just above its head the fires within flash and roar, tendrils of flame reaching out toward it as smoke crawls across the ceiling of the chamber. Anubhet, the Stygian Monolith carries a huge spiked shield, and a black sword only a giant could wield, both are made of the same stone as the rest of its body.

A powerful voice echoes in your mind, almost overwhelming your senses: "I thought my servants dealt with the occupants of this vault. Once more I will do what it seems my lessers cannot."

Anubhet’s Tactics

@UUID[Actor.zDaJ1TbODa2k7YbX]{Anubhet} is a fierce and aggressive combatant and is used to fighting with allies that it can coordinate with. Its sword and spiked shield give it great damage potential and defensive capability to cut down foes and create gaps in battle lines for its allies to take advantage of. 

While its three @UUID[Actor.Nk0R5yr4qhhL60zS]{Corrupted Ushabti} are alive Anubhet is made nearly invincible and is capable of being highly aggressive, taking risks that it otherwise would never consider, while using them to create openings to exploit. Once at least two of its servants have been defeated it becomes even more ferocious, but begins to use its abilities more judiciously to avoid being defeated.

Ansubek should...

  • Utilize his shield rush to break enemy lines, forcing them to adapt to his presence.
  • Work with his Corrupted Ushabti to wall in foes, or control available lines of movement.
  • Attack the most persistent, obnoxious, or otherwise aggravating enemies on the battlefield.

Combat Barks

Anubhet being an animated, possessed statue actually lacks a mouth with which to speak, and instead has the ability to telepathically communicate with any creatures within 60 feet of it which it can perceive. 

  • "You face a foe far beyond your power. How sad this realization has arrived too late to save you."
  • "The pitiful servants of Aten are mine now, what hope do you think you have?"
  • "Those that came before were not strong enough to stop me. Neither are you."
  • "You cannot fathom the true power of my wrath!"
  • "Your flesh is weak, your bones brittle. You are fit only to serve and die!"
  • "I do not need your useless Shabti to win this battle!"
  • "You have only destroyed your own allies, I am not diminished!"

The Sepulcher of Dusk.name: The Sepulcher of Dusk
The Sepulcher of Dusk.text:
Sepulcher of Dusk

This long chamber is lined with ancient sarcophagi, a single golden one resting at the center. Great icon braziers hang from the walls spitting purple flame and smoke, filling the room with an acrid haze that burns the lungs. At the back of the room is a massive throne meant for a giant.

If Anubhet is in the Sepulcher of Dusk

A massive obsidian giant with the head of a jackal and a golden headpiece rests on a giant stone chair. Its eyes burn with a terrible light and smoke from the braziers hung just above its head passively reach tendrils of flame reaching out toward it as smoke crawls across the ceiling of the chamber. Anubhet, the Stygian Monolith turns its head toward you, massive hands claiming a huge spiked shield, and a black sword only a giant could wield.

A powerful voice echoes in your mind, almost overwhelming your senses: "I see my Ushabti servants have failed their one duty."

Refer to @UUID[.x6EXTaq8AqWD62rF]{1m. Ushabti Trap} for the combat encounter with @UUID[Actor.zDaJ1TbODa2k7YbX]{Anubhet}.

What is Anubhet?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with @UUID[Actor.dXpHPQLRNOqj8SAm]{Kesi}, the party can learn:

Once a massive onyx statue gifted to the Demon Queen by a sculptor to the hoping to win her favor, Nehebkelat bestowed upon the statue a consciousness filled with an otherworldly hatred for mortal beings, and an unwavering devotion to her cause. Anubhet's first act was to stomp the life from its creator, killing him instantly, much to Nehebkelat's amusement. From that point forward it served as her most loyal of generals, subjugating constructs across the lands, twisting their magic to serve the Demon Queen instead of their creators.

Anubhet's Sword and Shield

Though they appear to be seprate items, these massive stone items are actually part of the malevolent construct's form and are considered part of it. When Anubhet is defeated these items also shatter apart like the rest of the creature, becoming unusable until Anubhet is resurrected by its master.

Sarcophagus of Dusk

Sarcophagus of Hanbal

Set upon an ornate platform of layered stone, the sarcophagus is made of pale sandstone, and decorated with rich orange paint. For all the fine detail in the figure, this one has very little precious metal incorporated into the cover. The figure has red gems for eyes which glow faintly, and the air around the sarcophagus still resonates with a palpable magical power. The stone around this tomb bears an unfathomable number of magical inscription.

It appears as though the cover has suffered some substantial damage, perhaps at the hands of Anubhet during a fit of rage or hatred for one of the people responsible for its master's downfall.

Who was Hanbal?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with Kesi, the party can learn:

Hanbal, the Dreaming Son, was once the order's greatest sage, an Abjuration wizard of the highest order. In his time he was known to be wise and careful, with a keen mind for magic and its construction. His expertise was integral in designing the very magics used to bind the Demon Queen here. Able to wield magic like no other, he knew that only his own soul would be powerful enough to contain Nehebkelat's might, and he chose to make that part of the seal, even if it robbed the order of his knowledge.

Investigating the Sarcophagus

Inscriptions curl around the base of the tomb and extend down into the various smaller levels of the dais.

  • [[/skill arc 20]]  This sarcophagus is marked with ancient draconic magic symbols of power that are simultaneously preserving the body within for a nearly unlimited time period, and directing the occupant's life force elsewhere in the vault. 
  • [[/skill his 20]] The elaborate pictograms depict a man that appears to be a wizard or other powerful sorcerer undertaking countless acts of magical prowess. Much of the imagery is obscure and without context, but indicates they were a highly accomplished in magic.
  • [[/skill rel 20]] The religious pictograms show a person training others in weaponry of all forms, leading hunting groups, and watching over other hunters attempting to sneak past him. See: @UUID[.FzZqwYUZsQvQkq8o#who-was-ur-atun?]{Who was Ur-Atun?} for guidance on what role this champion played in the Eyes of Aten.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): The old form of celestial script that appears on the base identifies the occupant as the Champion Hanbal, the Dreaming Son. It proclaims that he was Intelligent and of great Constitution, and that through these abilities he was able to subdue the mighty Anubhet, leading to its capture and imprisonment here.
  • Language Proficiency (Draconic): There are extensive collections of magical shorthand markings and symbols that have their roots in ancient draconic, each of them detailing fundamental magical concepts and early magical theories attributed to a legedary wizard known as Hanbal the Dreamer. See: Who was Hanbal? below for guidance on what his legend might entail.

Items Within

@Item[POABXKYbOSpUpCOx]{The Ring of Evenfall}

@Item[CDuXyWZzcCb0SyAh]{Scepter of Dusk}

South-East Hall.name: South-East Hall
South-East Hall.text:
Dark Halls and Scorpions

As you pass into the hallway beyond the scorpion mosaic you begin to notice a prevalence of little black scorpions scuttling about. More worryingly, the shadows in these halls seem to grow darker, and your light seems to only cover half of the distance as it should. You soon find yourselves squinting in the gloom, straining to see what lies ahead.

Hidden Pitfall Trap ([[/skill prc dc=18 passive]] to spot)

A large section of the floor ahead of the party is illusory and will cause the leading character to tumble into a slanted stone chute that carries them down to the Sepulcher of Night. This pitfall deals [[/damage 2d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage unless the victim can make a successful [[/skill acr 12]] check.

Investigating the Chute

It appears that this old chute was used in the construction of the vault. It doesn’t appear to be a dangerous trap in and of itself, as the angle of the chute would keep anyone from taking too painful of a tumble. However, it was very deliberately reopened to catch the unwary and send them somewhere likely very unpleasant.

Continue on toward...

@UUID[.FzZqwYUZsQvQkq8o]{1p. The Sepulcher of Night}

The Sepulcher of Night.name: The Sepulcher of Night
The Sepulcher of Night.text:
Entering the Sepulcher of Night

At the end of winding stairs (or a short chute ride) lies the pit of Serketraj the Midnight Whisper, a large square room with high ceilings and thin stone columns. The whole chamber is shrouded in an unnatural darkness that deepens every shadow and threatens to choke light sources out. Piles of bones are scattered across the floor and piled up around the columns, each of them seemingly stained with dark ink or tar. 

At the center of the room is a stone sarcophagus with bones piled around its base. It appears to be a mixture of white and black stone with gold and silver decorations. Notably, purple light blazes from the eyes of the carved figure on the sarcophagus lid, the magic seemingly weakening the darkness around it, leaving the sarcophagus plainly visible even when the rest of the chamber is not.

Encounter: Serketraj, the Midnight Whisper

Somewhere in the back of the chamber there is a clattering of moving bones and the sound of hard tapping on stone. Straining to see the source of the sound, the form of a massive scorpion with the torso of a humanoid woman becomes visible. Serketraj scuttles from the darkness, as scorpions made of pure shadow crawl from skulls and rib cages in her vicinity.

Vault Ambience: Sepulcher of Night

When the players first enter this room, begin playing this ambient track! @UUID[Playlist.td6mebjCgVupaImA.PlaylistSound.C9S3eQZghRTc4iRM]{Sepulcher of Night}

Who is Serketraj?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with @UUID[Actor.dXpHPQLRNOqj8SAm]{Kesi}, the party can learn:

Serketraj was once a mortal who rose to power in a secret society of death-worshipping cultists. This society of murderers made a great name and fortune for themselves as ruthless assassins, and she was the greatest among them. Yet for all her power and skill, the limits of her mortal body weighed heavily upon her. As she aged, muscles would weaken, strength would dissolve, and before long her body would fail her.

Serketraj sought out a means by which to transcend that mortality; she sought to make a deal with Nehebkelat. In return for the service of her cult of assassins the Demon Queen granted her wish and Serketraj ascended to her new form, becoming an immortal being of shadow and poison.

Serketraj's Tactics

@UUID[Actor.AiImuhfg9DPr5e6Q]{Serketraj} is an exceptionally tricky and deceptive being who has steeped herself in secrets and lies for centuries. When engaged in combat her first objective is to create disarray in her attackers. Her tactics involve creating darkness, separating her foes, constantly relocating, and selectively targeting enemies that are responsible for maintaining cohesion of the party. This often leads her to target casters, healers, and leaders as soon as they make their presence known. Otherwise she targets whoever appears the most isolated and vulnerable, preferring to pick her foes apart one-on-one.

Serketraj should...

  • Use her pincer attack in conjunction with Veil of Darkness, Shadow Slip, and Movement to grapple and relocate with enemies, pulling them away from their allies.
  • Take advantage of Creeping Darkness to keep enemies at bat while dealing with a single target.
  • Utilize Body of Shadow to avoid damaging attacks and spells, steal away grappled foes, or escape from dangerous enemies.

Serketraj's Darkness: We have included a 20ft radius light in the Sepulcher of Night which can be moved into place and activated to represent Serketraj's field of darkness. It begins deactivated in the scene's lighting layer.

Combat Barks

Serketraj does not speak in the traditional method that most creatures use (though she can), she instead prefers to use a limited telepathy to project images and create imaginary sounds in the minds of her victims. She effectively has 60 feet of telepathic speech which manifest as alien thoughts in the minds of those she communicates with, or whispered voices just over their shoulders.

Sarcophagus of Night

Sarcophagus of Ur-Atun

Simple yet well-appointed, the sarcophagus is made of gray stone and decorated using purple and black paint, accented in gold.  The figure on the cover has purple gems for eyes which glow faintly in the unnatural gloom of this chamber. It bears countless markings of magical and religious nature.

Who was Ur-Atun?

Through investigation of ancient scrolls and glyphs or conversation with Kesi, the party can learn:

Ur-Atun, the Midnight Sentinel was once the order's greatest tracker, a Ranger and monster slayer who specialized in hunting evil across the lands. He was the only person cunning and deceptive enough to capture Serketraj.  Stories say that he could sense evil for a hundred miles in all directions and track them even through a sandstorm. He is believed to be the greatest archer the lands ever knew, and was blessed with a divine bow made of moonlight itself which shot arrows of pure light.

Investigating the Sarcophagus

Inscriptions curl around the base of the tomb, peeking out from below a layer of stacked bones and skulls.  

  • [[/skill arc 20]] This sarcophagus is marked with ancient draconic magic symbols of power that are simultaneously preserving the body within for a nearly unlimited time period, and directing the occupant's life force elsewhere in the vault.
  • [[/skill his 20]] The elaborate pictograms depict a man with a bow that seems to shoot arrows from the moon, and is show slaying all manner of strange monsters. Much of the imagery lines up with a legendary hero known as the Midnight Sentinel. See: Who was Ur-Atun? above for guidance on what his legend might entail.
  • [[/skill rel 20]] The religious pictograms show a person training others in weaponry of all forms, leading hunting groups, and watching over other hunters attempting to sneak past him. See: Who was Ur-Atun? above for guidance on what role this champion played in the Eyes of Aten.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): The old form of celestial script that appears on the base identifies the occupant as the Champion Ur-Atun, the Midnight Sentinel. It proclaims that he was Wise and Dexterous, and that through these abilities he was able to track the elusive Serketaj, leading to her capture and imprisonment here.

Items Within

@Item[cMGgEu9l3VBOfTpK]{The Waxing Crescent}

@Item[tMExM7iR81ynnGGd]{Scepter of Night}

Hidden Bridge.name: Hidden Bridge
Hidden Bridge.text:
The Light Bridge Revealed

With the scepters in place the shafts all lock into place and slowly rotate to orient the scepter heads precisely as the central light pillar and it's glow becomes more intense. After a moment each of the scepter heads fire a beam of light at the central obelisk's capstone, which redirects them to reveal a magical walkway spanning a stretch of the pit. At the far end of this bridge a section of stone wall slides away, revealing a passage that surely leads to Nehebkelat's prison cell.

Once the bridge apears the beams from the scepters fade, and the scepters are released from the holes, and can be reclaimed.

Light Bridge Toggle.

This macro toggles on and off the light and walkway leading from the Dial of Aten. @UUID[Macro.kvLTqargBhaerucS]{Toggle Final Bridge}

Keeping the Scepters

Once the way has been opened the scepters will be released from their slots and can be taken again. Players can choose to reclaim the scepters, or remove their heads, gaining a holy symbol instead. Either way, the characters would be wise to collect the scepter heads as they are required to open the way to arena, and to rebind the Demon Queen. If they are forgotten, one of the ally npcs recommend they take the scepters or their heads with them.

The Descent

With the bridge revealed and the way open, the party can descend into the expansion created to contain the Demon Queen.

Continue onto Chapter 2: The Prison of Nehebkelat

@UUID[JournalEntry.vPmzQTMVZwRbbuu8.JournalEntryPage.ixwgNfh8mbG24Cn9]{2a. Final Hallway}

Final Hallway.name: Final Hallway
Final Hallway.text:
Scene Transition

Before continuing, activate the Scene @UUID[Scene.EEFG3GJqO5GTN6Jz]{The Prison of Nehebkelat}.

The Final Hallway

Narrow stairways descend to a landing and a broader hallway of stone. The walls bear carved reliefs depicting the battle to defeat the Demon Queen and her generals, their subsequent defeat, the hasty construction of the prison beneath the Vault of Aten, and the magic used in its creation.

At the distant end of the hall a heavy stone door is engraved with a familiar-looking carving of a massive cobra with its fangs bared. You cannot help but feel that this is a warning.

At the hall's midway point, two ancient wooden doors oppose one another. While dim light shines from below the western door, the light from below the eastern door seems to shift and change in a variety of chromatic colors. 

Examining the Hieroglyphs

The walls are carved with a chronological accounting of armies battling armies with the Champions of the Eyes of Aten playing their parts, with numerous other unknown but prominent figures rising and falling on either side of the conflict.

  • [[/skill religion 20]] or [[/skill history 20]] The pictograms show the horrible might of the Dread Generals and their armies of constructs, undead, elementals, and shadows supported by mortal legions. They crash and break against armies of mortals lead by the Eyes of Aten. All of this leads up to the confrontation with the Demon Queen, who is depicted as wielding six swords of fire, thunder, ice, and magic which she used to cut down a legion of soldiers herself.
  • [[/skill investigation 25]] An astute eye notices that the ancient depiction of the Demon Queen shows her as especially serpentine, with six arms and six swords.  
Examining the Doors

The doors are marked with painted symbols that could lend some insight into what awaits beyond them.

  • [[/skill arcana 18]], [[/skill history 18]], or [[/skill religion 18]] The western door bears ancient root hieroglyphs for common concepts such as magical restoration, and magical energy. The eastern door indicates concepts such as instruction, truth, magic, and power.
  • [[/skill perception 16]] or [[/skill investigation 16]] There is a faint sound of bubbling water coming from the western door, and a faint crackling of fire from the eastern door.

This hallway leads to the following areas:

Left to @UUID[.XRFEH9YeuRPOXEmS]{2b. Fountains of Restoration}

Right to @UUID[.miDLwf5556C3gG5L]{2c. Marked Obelisk Room}

Straight ahead to @UUID[.d2QkKiFARaMN1JaJ]{2d. The Demon Queen's Arena}

Fountains of Restoration.name: Fountains of Restoration
Fountains of Restoration.text:
Fountains of Magic and Light

Beyond the old stone door is a room filled with ancient urns clustered at the feet of massive jackal headed protector statues. In the center of the room is a tile mosaic depicting a red-gold sun whose rays of light end in outstretched hands. Beneath the sun is a symbol of eternal life and rebirth.

Here, fountains bubble with water that faintly glows, casting flickers of light across the walls and ceiling. The water is crystal clear, cold, and flows from a source somewhere beyond the stone spout. 

Investigating the Fountains

The water bubbling up into the basin glows with a strange prismatic energy, but is cool to the touch and clean of any debris or contamination. The fountain pillars and basins are covered in markings and hieroglyphics that might lend insight into what the fountains do.

  • [[/skill arcana 15]] The fountain is marked with truly obscure symbols for the school of restoration and transmutation.
  • [[/skill investigation 18]] The fountain is marked with ancient hieroglyphs that depict frail figures drinking of the fountain and becoming strong again.
  • [[/skill religion 15]] The fountain is marked with an ancient holy symbol for divine restoration.

Drinking the Water

Drinking from the rejuvenation fountain removes any diseases, curses, and detrimental conditions currently affecting them and infuses them with a little more vital energy and youth, making them appear a touch younger and healthier than they once were (remove [[/r 1d6]] years). It also fully restores the PC as though they just completed a long rest. The fountain can only be used by a character once per 24 hours, and it provides no more youthful rejuvenation after the first time.

Marked Obelisk Room.name: Marked Obelisk Room
Marked Obelisk Room.text:
The Six Pillars

This room holds six obelisks about six feet tall and capped with glowing gems of various colors. Each one radiates an aura of light and directs a beam of it toward a central swirl of light and color hovering about four feet in the air over an intricate mosaic.

The obelisks are a bit chipped and worn from age, but still hold hundreds of hieroglyphic and archaic words, each one painstakingly carved into the stone a thousand years ago. Each obelish has a stone shelf which holds an ancient scroll in an aged case.

Investigating the Obelisks

The pillars are covered in markings and have small shelves with ornate scrolls, these may lend insight into their purpose!

Note: If Kesi is present she is more than willing to explain the pillars, and can bypass the need to investigate or study the pillars. Otherwise more can be learned through the methods below!

  • [[/skill arcana 20]] There are numerous magical symbols etched into the stone, some of it explanatory, but most of it designed to turn the pillars into focal points of power, and are meant to create a central magical nexus at the focal point of the beams.
  • [[/skill investigation 18]] The stones are marked with many identical symbols, indicating they all serve a similar purpose or represent things that are alike. The beems are also focused intensely on a central mass of light with waves of energy moving toward it, indicating they are working in concert toward a central goal. This is likely a model of some large apparatus further ahead, and is perhaps what's holding the Demon Queen in place.
  • [[/skill perception 20]] The light of the stones carries with it a subtle sense of energy. The beams of light provide a much more noticeable form of this, which becomes most intense at its focal point, where it forms a swirling multi-color shell of light.
  • [[/skill history 20]] Each of the pillars bear ancient root symbols in Draconic and Celestial which denote various core or intrinsic abilities and characteristics that people can have. See Pillar Attribute by Color below for a guide of what each pillar represents.

The Six Scrolls of Heroic Ability

The six obelisks are all directly connected to the six core abilities that all characters have, and will be vital to defeating the Demon Queen later on. The scrolls sitting on their shelves explain that pillar's purpose, giving the players a chance to understand the puzzle at the heart of the final encounter.

This section is a chance for the party to discover through investigation how the rules detailed in @UUID[.3UYTQMRV8CopMNPE]{2e. Obelisk Mechanics} will work.

Investigating the Scrolls

The scrolls are an intense collection of ancient and obscure celestial, draconic, primordial scripts, arcane notation, religious pictograms, and unintelligible writing that was likely the common writing at the time.

  • [[/skill arcana 20]] Each of the scrolls bear complex arcane and mystic notations detailing the intricate magic of the pillar and the chamber. Each pillar appears able to channel an innate attribute of whoever touches it, using it to build an arcane connection between a source elsewhere in the vault and the pillar itself. Several of the designs bear striking resemblance to necromantic and transmutation magical principles.
  • [[/skill history 20]] Each of the scrolls bears pictograms and images depicting feats of strength, agility, great performances for audiences, and similar. The feats are all of a single type per scroll, and many of them line up with ancient deeds of fabled heroes of antiquity. See Pillar Attribute by Color below for a guide of what each pillar represents, and the hero dossiers in each of the Sepulcher journal entries here: @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.MwQMOshR3SD8Mkan]{1f. The Sepulcher of Dawn}, @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.flzpZlZt8ZTeVBNK]{1j. The Sepulcher of Day}, @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.6TODq5DKCZxTD8tJ]{1n. The Sepulcher of Dusk}, @UUID[JournalEntry.n6Fb0D0xskxz4zR4.JournalEntryPage.FzZqwYUZsQvQkq8o]{1p. The Sepulcher of Night}. The scrolls are telling of the deeds of the heroes based on their abilities.
  • [[/skill religion 20]] An extensive network of carefully laid out divine symbols read more like an arcane diagram than a religious piece of art. It appears as though aspects of the obelisks are meant to directly channel light and power from the sun itself and some divine source beyond it. Perhaps the Eyes of Aten found or were given the means to channel godly might directly through the obelisks.
  • Language Proficiency (Draconic): Large swathes of each scroll detail how the magical designs of the pillars are meant to direct innate magical and spiritual energy of a being through conduits built into the vault itself.
  • Language Proficiency (Celestial): Large sections of the scrolls are dedicated to extolling the divine virtues of the ability tied to that scroll, and how the spirit is empowered through the cultivation of great strength, wisdom, intelligence, and so forth. That through this greatness they will have the power to overcome the endless evil that plagues the lands.
  • Language Proficiency (Primodial, or a dialect): You recognize a large amount of elemental magical symbols in the writing and magical diagrams in the scrolls. Some of the text indicates that the pillars actively dampen the presence of powerful elemental sources they are attached to, and that this was by design. It seems that the Vault of Aten was built to directly hinder the natural powers of the Dread Generals, making them easier to overcome.

Pillar Attributes by Color

  • The Yellow Obelisk bears the hieroglyph for the aspect of Strength.
  • The Cyan Obelisk bears the hieroglyph for the aspect of Dexterity.
  • The Red Obelisk bears  the hieroglyph for the aspect of Charisma.
  • The Blue  Obelisk bears  the hieroglyph for the aspect of Wisdom.
  • The Green Obelisk bears  the hieroglyph for the aspect of Constitution.
  • The Purple Obelisk bears  the hieroglyph for the aspect of Intelligence.

The Demon Queen's Arena.name: The Demon Queen's Arena
The Demon Queen's Arena.text:
Door to the Demon Queen's Cell

Nearing the heavy stone door you can see that the massive cobra carving with its fangs bared is joined by depictions of snakes, demons, chains, and archaic text warning onlookers of the great danger within. You cannot help but feel that these are warnings meant to ward off even those that cannot read the script. Below them are a series of pictograms showing the four scepters of the sky touched to the snake, causing the door to open.

Nehebkelat, The Demon Queen is bound within. Upon preparing for the final fight, Abasi will urge the heroes to remember that the Demon Queen is immortal and unkillable, therefore the only path to victory is binding her again. Attempting to defeat her martially is a hopeless endeavor, as she cannot truly die.

Entering the Arena

Nehebkelat's Cell

The final prison of the Demon Queen is a massive circular arena. Piled against the walls are thousands upon thousands of blackened bones of countless dead. The longer you stare at the piles of bones, the more you begin to hear the wailing keen of the tormented victims of the Demon Queen. Forcing the horror from your mind, you blink and for a moment see the bones vanish.

As the piles of bone vanish you also realize that the doorway you entered through has turned into a wall of solid stone bearing the four symbols on the amulets of the sky!

On either end of the room narrow stairs rise up to a platform that surrounds the arena, with six golden pyramids jutting from the stone, each one capped with a brilliant gem that glows with energy.

At the center of the arena is a raised platform lined with wailing skulls, and atop it is the massive Demon Queen, shackled in place by magical chains coming from three of the pyramids around the arena.

The horror before you is that of a half-woman half-snake, a mass of slithering, scaled flesh. The Demon Queen's form is equal parts beautiful and terrible, with six arms, a mouth of fangs, and glowing gold serpent eyes. In each hand Nehebkelat holds a different longsword, wielding them like they weigh nothing in her grip.

On each of the Demon Queen's forearms are metal bracers with glowing gems. Half of them are dark, the other half glow with power light, with spectral chains hanging between them and a pyramid with a gem of matching color. As the great marilith's arms move in a slow, hypnotizing sword dance, you can see that some of her arms are not as free, causing her to periodically struggle against her magical bonds.

Final Encounter: Nehebkelat

The Demon Queen's Gambit

Nehebkelat goes still upon seeing the group, and angrily hisses. “I am disappointed. I was told that the Eyes of Aten were no more. Both in and outside this accursed vault."

She clenches a fist and pulls at the air, a magical chain appearing attached to her shackle. "When I am freed from these bonds I’ll have to remind my servants of what happens to those that lie to me...”

The Demon Queen pauses with that thought, a moment of calculation evident on her features. "You know... this could be quite simple and beneficial for the both of us. I know this vault is filled with treasures. If you release me I'll grant you an army of minions to deliver it to whatever pitiful hovels you call home. Think of it: you could live as royalty, and if you wished to serve me... well, even greater power, riches, and influence could be yours. Perhaps even immortality!"

Of course, Abasi refuses to accept this path  and begins heading for the binding pillars to reassert the magic holding the Demon Queen in place. If Kesi, Uraeus or Last are present they also will outright refuse to serve the Demon Queen, opting to fulfill their divine duty!

Note: This combat relies on @UUID[.3UYTQMRV8CopMNPE]{2e. Obelisk Mechanics} as the party's means of defeating Nehebkelat. Attempting to defeat her by simply reducing her hit points to 0 will not be as successful as expected. See Defeating the Demon Queen below for details.

Nehebkelat's Tactics

Nehebkelat is a merciless combatant who relishes combat as a chance to demonstrate her physical superiority over others. She will target anyone who directly engages her in melee combat, calls her out, or issues challenges. If and when they fall, she simply moves on to the next foe. If an enemy proves especially dangerous, she will change focus to neutralize them to the best of her ability.

Anchor Beams.

This macro should be used when Nehebkelat finishes moving in the arena, or is pulled back to the arena center. It automatically refocuses the beams of light on her token. @UUID[Macro.W0RT57M84QGq2Lr3]{Anchor Nehebkelat Beams}

Combat Barks

The Demon Queen begins her battle confident, knowing that she has moved her pieces on the board carefully and is on the verge of escape. Any setbacks suffered at the hands of the party are minor, or at least not worth acknowledging. However, as the fight goes on and she gets closer to being rebound she will become more volatile and incensed at the mortals threatening her escape.

  • "I see my generals have failed in destroying all of the Eyes of Aten. No matter, the time of ascension is at hand and your order is too late to stop it. It has already begun."
  • "Consider that we do not have to be enemies. You have bested my generals and proven your worthiness, take their places beside me and we can accomplish incredible things."
  • "I have had one thousand years to plan your undoing, you will burn like locusts before my flames!"
  • "Your brotherhood and their army of hired 'heroes' were barely enough the first time! An old man and a gaggle of hapless adventurers will not be enough now!"
  • "I will not spend another thousand years in this hole! You will not succeed!"
  • "Stop! I will give you riches, power, kingdoms! Anything you desire in the lands are yours if you stand by me as my new generals!"
  • "Fools! You may have stopped me, but I am eternal! In a thousand years you will not even be memories, and the seals will once again weaken!"

Defeating the Demon Queen

Though difficult, it's not impossible to reduce the Demon Queen to 0 hit points. If this occurs she will be &Reference[incapacitated] for 1 minute (10 rounds), but cannot be permanently killed. Any attempts to decapitate, maim, disintegrate, banish, petrify, or entomb her automatically fail as such mortal wounds magically heal almost instantly.

After a minute passes she will rise again with half of her maximum hit points and begin attempting to free herself again. If she is observed during this time it's clear that her wounds are rapidly closing as some magical force repairs her body. As the minute runs out she will begin to twitch and move indicating she's about to reawaken.

If the players manage to fully shackle her while she's incapacitated, the timer is extended by 2 additional rounds, giving them a little more time to get in place and finally lock her down for another thousand years.

For mechanics on shackling the Demon Queen before or after incapacitating her see:

@UUID[.3UYTQMRV8CopMNPE]{2e. Obelisk Mechanics}

Obelisk Mechanics.name: Obelisk Mechanics
Obelisk Mechanics.text:
The Binding Obelisks

The Demon Queen begins the fight with three of the chains active. In order for the Demon Queen to be defeated, she must be fully re-bound.

Each pillar around the room is a focal point of a potent magical binding spell and is connected to a specific aspect.
